did.head: Overview

origination.label: Creator:
origination.corpname: Stanford University. Office of Public Affairs.

did.abstract: Video recordings of the events and ceremonies during the celebration marking the centennial of the start of construction of Stanford University. Speakers included George P. Shultz, Joe Clark, Bernardo Sepúlveda Amor, Donald Kennedy, Warren Christopher, David M. Kennedy, and H. Donald Winbigler. Other subjects include preparation of the ceremony sites, audiences, panel discussions, music performances, and interviews with students and alumni. Collection includes original footage and the final edited version

repository.label: Repository:
repository.corpname: Department of Special Collections and University Archives

accessrestrict.head: Information about Access
accessrestrict.p: This collection is open for research.

userestrict.head: Ownership & Copyright
userestrict.p: All requests to reproduce, publish, quote from, or otherwise use collection materials must be submitted in writing to the Head of Special Collections and University Archives, Stanford University Libraries, Stanford, California 94304-6064. Consent is given on behalf of Special Collections as the owner of the physical items and is not intended to include or imply permission from the copyright owner. Such permission must be obtained from the copyright owner, heir(s) or assigns. See: http://library.stanford.edu/depts/spc/pubserv/permissions.html.
Restrictions also apply to digital representations of the original materials. Use of digital files is restricted to research and educational purposes.

prefercite.head: Cite As
prefercite.p: "Cornerstone: Making History Again" (V0037). Department of Special Collections and University Archives, Stanford University Libraries, Stanford, Calif.

scopecontent.head: Description of the Collection
scopecontent.p: Video recordings of the events and ceremonies during the celebration marking the centennial of the start of construction of Stanford University. Speakers included George P. Shultz, Joe Clark, Bernardo Sepúlveda Amor, Donald Kennedy, Warren Christopher, David M. Kennedy, and H. Donald Winbigler. Other subjects include preparation of the ceremony sites, audiences, panel discussions, music performances, and interviews with students and alumni. Collection includes original footage and the final edited version
